DOC.detailed_description: The Aim : assess effect treatment preoperative anaemia intravenous iron haematological parameter patient elective colorectal surgery . Primary Hypothesis : postoperative treatment intravenous iron increase level haemoglobin , ferritin , red cell count superior compare placebo . Secondary effect : treatment intravenous iron v placebo provide reduction blood transfusion , postoperative complication hospital stay . The Objectives : 1 . To estimate rate preoperative anaemia patient elective colorectal surgery . 2 . To assess dynamic change total blood count value colorectal surgery patient treat postoperative intravenous iron . 3 . To compare change total blood count value time colorectal surgery patient treat intravenous iron versus colorectal surgery patient control group . Methods : The prospective , double-blinded study include American Society Anaesthesiology ( ASA ) I-III patient , age 18-75 year , admit elective colorectal surgery . Preoperatively , patient level haemoglobin 90-120 g/l identify serum ferritin test . In case ferritin < 100 mkg/l , patient blindly randomize one two group : treatment group ( group T ) give 1000 mg intravenous iron ( iron isomaltoside , Orivas , Pharmacosmos ) postoperative recovery ward control group ( group C ) give volume intravenous saline ( placebo ) . Patients group provide general anaesthesia ( fentanyl , propofol , atracurium , inhale sevoflurane maintenance ) tracheal extubation transfer recovery ward . Patient blood test : total blood count , haemoglobin , haematocrit , mean corpuscular volume ( MCV ) , mean corpuscular haemoglobin ( MCH ) , plasma ferritin ) assess group 1 day preoperatively , day 1 3 postoperatively , day discharge 4 week discharge department surgery . The level reticulocyte reticulocyte haemoglobin concentration determine day discharge 4 week discharge . According study protocol , group also compare term clinical recovery , requirement intravenous fluid blood transfusion duration hospital stay .
